preamble.title: hyperlane/cardano
preamble.description: Hyperlane cross-chain messaging protocol for Cardano

cardano/transaction/OutputReference.title: OutputReference
cardano/transaction/OutputReference.description:
An `OutputReference` is a unique reference to an output on-chain. The `output_index`
 corresponds to the position in the output list of the transaction (identified by its id)
 that produced that output

deferred_recipient/DeferredRecipientInne.title: DeferredRecipientInner
deferred_recipient/DeferredRecipientInne.description:
Deferred Recipient

 A Hyperlane recipient that defers message processing to a separate step.
 Use this pattern when:
 1. The relayer cannot know how to build complex outputs
 2. Processing needs to happen separately (manually, via dApp, automated service, etc.)
 3. You need complex business logic that requires custom output construction

 ## Two-Phase Processing

 **Phase 1 - Relayer stores message (HandleMessage):**
 - Mailbox.Process verifies ISM
 - Recipient.HandleMessage is called
 - State UTXO continues UNCHANGED (or minimal change)
 - NEW: Message UTXO created at recipient address with StoredMessageDatum
 - NEW: Message NFT minted (proves legitimacy)

 **Phase 2 - Process stored message (ProcessStoredMessage):**
 - Query for UTXOs with message NFT policy
 - Consume Message UTXO + State UTXO
 - Build complex outputs based on business logic
 - Message NFT is burned (prevents replay)

 ## Security Model

 The message NFT prevents fake message attacks:
 - Anyone can create UTXOs at any address on Cardano
 - Without NFT, attacker could create fake message UTXOs
 - Message NFT policy ONLY allows minting when Mailbox is in inputs
 - Mailbox only processes ISM-verified messages
 - Therefore: NFT existence = message is legitimate
 - Only process UTXOs containing the NFT
 - NFT burn prevents replay attacks

 ## State Structure

 The inner state is minimal - just tracks message counts.
 Complex state should be in the message UTXOs or built during processing.
 Inner state for deferred recipient - intentionally minimal

example_generic_recipient/GenericRecipie.title: GenericRecipientInner
example_generic_recipient/GenericRecipie.description:
Example: Generic Recipient
 A minimal Hyperlane recipient that stores received messages

 This is an EXAMPLE contract demonstrating the standard pattern for
 Hyperlane-compatible recipients using the Generic type:
 1. Use HyperlaneRecipientDatum wrapper for state
 2. Use HyperlaneRecipientRedeemer for actions
 3. Verify mailbox is the caller for HandleMessage (via NFT check)
 4. Maintain state continuation

 See also: example_deferred_recipient.ak for deferred message processing

 ## Security Model

 Recipients are protected by **NFT-based authentication**:

 ### Why NFT, Not Script Hash?

 Anyone can create a UTXO at any script address with any datum. If we only
 checked "is there an input from the mailbox script address?", an attacker
 could:
 1. Create a fake UTXO at the mailbox address with malicious datum
 2. Spend that fake UTXO to bypass security checks

 NFTs solve this because:
 - Only ONE NFT with a given policy_id can exist (enforced by minting policy)
 - The real mailbox UTXO contains this unique NFT
 - Attackers cannot mint another NFT with the same policy_id
 - Checking for the NFT guarantees we're interacting with the REAL mailbox

 ### ISM (Interchain Security Module)

 The `ism` field in the datum is reserved for future use. Currently, all
 recipients use the mailbox's default ISM.

 **Why?** On Cardano, anyone can create a UTXO at any script address with
 any datum. If the mailbox read the ISM from the recipient's datum, an
 attacker could create a fake recipient UTXO with a malicious ISM.

 For recipients needing custom security, the mailbox owner can configure
 a stricter default ISM.

 ## Datum Structure

 ```
 HyperlaneRecipientDatum {
   ism: Option<ScriptHash>,        // Custom ISM, or None for default
   last_processed_nonce: Option<Int>, // For message ordering
   inner: GenericRecipientInner,   // Your contract-specific state
 }
 ```

 Contract-specific state for this generic recipient

fields.title: must_be_spent
fields.description: True = must be spent, False = reference input only

types/Checkpoint.title: Checkpoint
types/Checkpoint.description:
Checkpoint data that validators sign
 Hyperlane validators sign checkpoints with this structure:
 1. domain_hash = keccak256(origin || merkle_tree_hook || "HYPERLANE")
 2. digest = keccak256(domain_hash || merkle_root || merkle_index || message_id)
 3. signed = EIP-191(digest)

fields.title: merkle_root
fields.description: Merkle root of the message tree (32 bytes)

fields.title: origin_merkle_tree_hook
fields.description:
Origin merkle tree hook address (32 bytes, typically the origin mailbox)
 This is used in the domain hash for validator signing

fields.title: merkle_index
fields.description: Merkle tree index (nonce of the message in the tree)

fields.title: message_id
fields.description: Message ID (32 bytes) - keccak256 hash of the message

anyOf.title: ProcessStoredMessage
anyOf.description:
Process a stored message
 Consumes the message UTXO, burns the NFT, creates custom outputs

fields.title: message_id
fields.description: The message ID being processed (must match NFT asset name)

fields.title: gas_price
fields.description: Gas price in remote chain units

types/HyperlaneRecipientDatum$deferred_r.title: HyperlaneRecipientDatum
types/HyperlaneRecipientDatum$deferred_r.description:
Standard wrapper for recipient datums
 Recipients should use this pattern to be compatible with the relayer

types/HyperlaneRecipientDatum$example_ge.title: HyperlaneRecipientDatum
types/HyperlaneRecipientDatum$example_ge.description:
Standard wrapper for recipient datums
 Recipients should use this pattern to be compatible with the relayer

types/HyperlaneRecipientRedeemer$Void.title: HyperlaneRecipientRedeemer
types/HyperlaneRecipientRedeemer$Void.description:
Standard redeemer for recipients

 SECURITY: Recipients MUST verify that keccak256(encode_message(message)) == message_id
 This ensures the data was validated by the ISM (which signs the message_id).
 Without this check, an attacker could provide fake origin/sender/body data.

anyOf.title: HandleMessage
anyOf.description:
Handle incoming Hyperlane message
 The recipient MUST verify: keccak256(encode_message(message)) == message_id

fields.title: message_id
fields.description:
The message ID (keccak256 hash of encoded message)
 This is what the ISM validated - recipient must verify message hashes to this

types/HyperlaneRecipientRedeemer$types/D.title: HyperlaneRecipientRedeemer
types/HyperlaneRecipientRedeemer$types/D.description:
Standard redeemer for recipients

 SECURITY: Recipients MUST verify that keccak256(encode_message(message)) == message_id
 This ensures the data was validated by the ISM (which signs the message_id).
 Without this check, an attacker could provide fake origin/sender/body data.

anyOf.title: HandleMessage
anyOf.description:
Handle incoming Hyperlane message
 The recipient MUST verify: keccak256(encode_message(message)) == message_id

fields.title: message_id
fields.description:
The message ID (keccak256 hash of encoded message)
 This is what the ISM validated - recipient must verify message hashes to this

anyOf.title: SetGasOracle
anyOf.description: Admin: set gas oracle for a domain

anyOf.title: Dispatch
anyOf.description: Outbound: dispatch a message to another chain

anyOf.title: Process
anyOf.description: Inbound: process a message from another chain

types/MerkleTreeState.title: MerkleTreeState
types/MerkleTreeState.description:
Merkle tree state stored in datum
 Stores full branch state for incremental tree updates
 This costs ~4.4 ADA more in minUTxO but enables proper on-chain merkle validation

fields.title: branches
fields.description:
Branch hashes at each level (32 branches, each 32 bytes)
 From leaf level to root level

types/Message.title: Message
types/Message.description:
Message structure (matches Hyperlane spec)
 This is the core data structure for cross-chain messages

fields.title: sender
fields.description: Sender address on origin chain (32 bytes)

types/MessageNftRedeemer.title: MessageNftRedeemer
types/MessageNftRedeemer.description: Redeemer for message NFT minting policy

anyOf.title: MintMessage
anyOf.description:
Mint a message NFT when storing a message
 Asset name = message_id (32 bytes)

anyOf.title: BurnMessage
anyOf.description: Burn a message NFT when processing a stored message

fields.title: validators
fields.description: Validators per origin domain: List of (domain, validators)

fields.title: thresholds
fields.description: Threshold per origin domain: List of (domain, threshold)

anyOf.title: Verify
anyOf.description:
Verification: verify validators signed the checkpoint
 The checkpoint commits to a merkle root containing the message

 Security model:
 1. Relayer recovers public key from signature off-chain (using v/recovery ID)
 2. ISM verifies the signature on-chain using verify_ecdsa_secp256k1_signature
 3. ISM computes Ethereum address from the verified public key
 4. ISM checks the address is in the trusted validators list

 This provides cryptographic binding: an attacker cannot forge a signature
 without the validator's private key.

fields.title: validator_signatures
fields.description: Validator signatures with recovered public keys

anyOf.title: SetValidators
anyOf.description:
Admin: set validators for a domain
 validators should be Ethereum addresses (20 bytes each)

anyOf.title: SetThreshold
anyOf.description: Admin: set threshold for a domain

fields.title: script_hash
fields.description: Script hash of the recipient validator

fields.title: owner
fields.description:
Owner who can modify/remove this registration
 This is the KEY security field - only this key can update the registration

fields.title: state_locator
fields.description: NFT locator to find the state UTXO (contains datum)

fields.title: reference_script_locator
fields.description:
NFT locator to find the reference script UTXO
 None = script is embedded in state UTXO's reference_script field

fields.title: custom_ism
fields.description: Override default ISM for this recipient

types/RecipientType.title: RecipientType
types/RecipientType.description: Recipient type determines how relayer constructs outputs

anyOf.title: Generic
anyOf.description: State in, state out, no other effects

anyOf.title: TokenReceiver
anyOf.description: Mints/releases tokens to address specified in message body

anyOf.title: Deferred
anyOf.description:
Defers message processing to a separate step
 The relayer creates a message UTXO with an NFT proving legitimacy
 Messages are processed separately (manually, via dApp, automated service, etc.)

fields.title: message_policy
fields.description:
Minting policy for message NFTs (proves message is legitimate)
 The policy only allows minting when mailbox is in inputs

anyOf.title: Register
anyOf.description:
Initial registration of a new recipient
 Requires: owner signature AND state NFT in inputs

anyOf.title: UpdateRegistration
anyOf.description:
Update an existing registration (owner only)
 Requires: current owner's signature

anyOf.title: Unregister
anyOf.description:
Remove a registration (owner only)
 Requires: current owner's signature

anyOf.title: TransferRegistrationOwnership
anyOf.description:
Transfer registration ownership (both parties must sign)
 Requires: current owner AND new owner signatures

anyOf.title: AdminRegister
anyOf.description:
Admin-only registration (bypasses ownership check)
 Requires: registry admin signature

types/UtxoLocator.title: UtxoLocator
types/UtxoLocator.description: How to locate a UTXO (by NFT marker)

types/ValidatorAnnounceDatum.title: ValidatorAnnounceDatum
types/ValidatorAnnounceDatum.description:
Validator announcement datum
 Each validator creates a UTXO with this datum to announce their storage location

 The validator_address is the 20-byte Ethereum address derived from the validator's
 secp256k1 public key. This is the same address used to verify checkpoints on all
 chains, enabling cross-chain validator discovery.

fields.title: validator_address
fields.description:
Validator Ethereum address (20 bytes)
 Derived from secp256k1 pubkey: keccak256(uncompressed_pubkey)[12:32]
 This must match the address used for checkpoint signing

fields.title: mailbox_policy_id
fields.description: Mailbox policy ID this announcement applies to

types/ValidatorAnnounceRedeemer.title: ValidatorAnnounceRedeemer
types/ValidatorAnnounceRedeemer.description:
Validator announce redeemer

 For announcements, the validator must provide an ECDSA secp256k1 signature
 over the announcement digest. This proves they control the private key
 corresponding to the announced Ethereum address.

anyOf.title: Announce
anyOf.description:
Create new announcement or update existing
 Requires ECDSA signature from the validator's secp256k1 key

fields.title: compressed_pubkey
fields.description: Compressed secp256k1 public key (33 bytes: 0x02/0x03 prefix + x-coordinate)

fields.title: uncompressed_pubkey
fields.description: Uncompressed secp256k1 public key (64 bytes: x || y, no 0x04 prefix)

types/ValidatorSignature.title: ValidatorSignature
types/ValidatorSignature.description:
Validator signature with recovered public key in both formats
 The relayer recovers the public key off-chain and passes both formats for on-chain verification

fields.title: compressed_pubkey
fields.description:
Compressed public key (33 bytes: 0x02/0x03 prefix + x-coordinate)
 Used for verifyEcdsaSecp256k1Signature per CIP-49

fields.title: uncompressed_pubkey
fields.description:
Uncompressed public key (64 bytes: x || y, no 0x04 prefix)
 Used to compute Ethereum address on-chain: keccak256(pubkey)[12:32]

fields.title: remote_routes
fields.description: Remote routes (other chains): List of (domain, route_address)

anyOf.title: ReceiveTransfer
anyOf.description: Receive tokens from another chain (via Hyperlane message)

anyOf.title: Collateral
anyOf.description: Lock tokens in vault, release on receive

anyOf.title: Synthetic
anyOf.description: Mint synthetic tokens on receive, burn on send

vault/VaultDatum.title: VaultDatum
vault/VaultDatum.description:
Vault Datum
 Stores configuration and accounting for locked tokens

fields.title: warp_route_hash
fields.description: Warp route that controls this vault

fields.title: token
fields.description: Token being locked (None for ADA vault)

anyOf.title: Lock
anyOf.description: Lock tokens (called by warp route on TransferRemote)

anyOf.title: Release
anyOf.description: Release tokens (called by warp route on ReceiveTransfer)
